{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presented with primary amenorrhea, short stature, webbed neck, widely spaced nipples, weak pulses in lower extremity, and streak ovaries. The histology of the ovary showed no oocyte. This is suggestive of gonadal dysgenesis. The raised FSH level further supports this diagnosis. The patient's karyotype is likely to be 45XO as it is a common cause of primary amenorrhea with gonadal dysgenesis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
